availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John C. Welch (Nicholasville, Jessamine County, Kentucky, physician and soldier)

body.p: Nicholasville, Jessamine County, Kentucky, physician and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Lizzie Welch. Father of Ella Welch, John Welch, Henry Welch, Lizzie Welch, Thomas Welch. Physician in Jessamine County in 1860. Mustered in as surgeon in the 20th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) on January 6, 1862, in Smithland. Mustered out on January 17, 1865, in Louisville.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 36, 863, 955.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine, Nicholasville, p. 126.
